description:
Borrowed from Middle French navigation, from Latin nāvigātiōnem, accusative singular of nāvigātiō (“sailing, navigation”), from nāvigātus, perfect passive participle of nāvigō (“sail”).
Morphologically navigate +‎ -ion

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The theory, practice and technology of charting a course for a ship, aircraft or spaceship or (colloquially) road vehicle.
examples: An ocean-going yachtsman must be competent at night navigation

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Traffic or travel by vessel, especially commercial shipping.
